source_sentence: 而其少年，尚得如是，若後成長，必定應當作王國師。
translation: That boy, however, will still be like this; if he grows later, he'll surely become a king's national teacher.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，我須方便除滅其體，如是則我得成大利；
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, I need to skillfully eliminate their essence. In this way, I will attain great benefit.

source_sentence: 若不然者，終奪我位。』
translation: If you don't, they'll ultimately take my position.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，其父知自長子內心，如是於那羅陀私生惡念，既覺知已，作是思惟：『我此小兒，
translation: “At that time, knowing the inner mind of his own eldest son, the father secretly had this bad idea for Nārada. Knowing it, he thought:

source_sentence: 聰慧可憐，勿令為兄之所奪命。』
translation: Wise and pitiable, don't let him be taken away by his brother.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，『應須方便莫令其知。』
translation: After he had this thought, he said, 'Shouldn't you make them know it with skillful means?'

source_sentence: 「爾時南方有一城，名優禪耶尼，去城不遠，有頻陀山，其山中有一老仙人，
translation: “At that time in the southern direction was a city called Udyānani. Not far from the city there was Mount Bimbisāra, on which lived an elderly holy man named Vaiśravaṇa.

source_sentence: 名阿私陀，在中居住。
translation: His name was Asita, and he lived there.

source_sentence: 彼仙洞解一切韋陀并及諸論，以得四禪，具五神通。
translation: That sage had thoroughly understood all the Vedas and treatises, attained the fourth dhyāna, and possessed five supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 是那羅陀童子外舅。
translation: This is the uncle of the boy Nārada.

source_sentence: 是時國師大婆羅門并及其婦，即將其子那羅陀身往彼山中，對共付囑阿私陀仙，
translation: The great brahman teachers of the country and their wives then proceeded to that mountain with their son Nārada, entrusted it to the sage Asita.

source_sentence: 以為弟子。
translation: He thought he was a disciple.

source_sentence: 其阿私陀既受領得那羅陀已，教詔顯示，不久成就，獲得四禪、具五神通。
translation: After he had received and mastered the Nārada, Asita instructed him to show that he would soon attain the fourth meditation and possess the five supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 「爾時，梵志阿私陀仙，將其弟子那羅陀身，即出山向波羅[木*奈]城，
translation: “At that time, the priest sage Asita, taking his disciple Nārada’s body with him, left the mountain and approached the city of Benares.

source_sentence: 即於城外，造立草庵，在中居住。
translation: He built a grass hermitage outside the city and lived in it.

source_sentence: 晝夜六時，作如是教，大聲唱言：『善哉善哉！
translation: At six o'clock during the day, he made this teaching and shouted out loudly, 'Good, good!

source_sentence: 汝那羅陀，佛今出世(如是三稱)。
translation: You, Nārada, are the buddhas that have now appeared in the world (three such names).

source_sentence: 汝應彼邊，剃落出家，修行梵行，必當長夜大得利益，大得快樂，自利身已復應利他。』
translation: You should shave yourself off from that side, leave home, and cultivate the religious practice, for which you'll surely attain great benefits over a long period of time and great happiness; after benefiting yourself and benefiting others, you should also benefit others.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼老阿私陀仙作如是語，教其弟子那羅陀已，不經多時而取命終。
translation: “At the time, that old sage Asita said this, and after teaching his disciple Nārada to do so, he didn’t live for long.

source_sentence: 阿私陀仙命終之後，時彼梵志私陀仙人所有世間利養名聞，悉是弟子那羅陀得。
translation: When the sage Asita's life ended, all the worldly benefits and reputations of that priest asita sage were all obtained by his disciple Nārada.

source_sentence: 時那羅陀以世利養名聞多故，貪戀著心，無有正念，更不作想求覓勝上，
translation: Because of worldly benefits and fame, Nārada became greedy with attachment, lacking right mindfulness. Nor did he think to seek superiority.

source_sentence: 不信有佛有法有僧。
translation: They don't believe that there are buddhas, dharmas, and saṃgha.

source_sentence: 「爾時，海內伊羅鉢龍(隋言藿香葉)王，既受龍身，心生厭離，欲求解脫，
translation: “At that time, the king of the nāga Elāpattra (known as Yaśas in the Sui dynasty) at sea. Having been touched by the body of the nāga, he became disgusted and wished to seek liberation

source_sentence: 不樂於彼穢濁惡想，而作是念：『往昔世尊迦葉如來、多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀，
translation: They do not delight in those impure and evil thoughts but think, “Once the World-honored One Tathāgata Kassapa, a Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One, or Samyak-saṃbuddha.

source_sentence: 親授我記：「汝大龍王！
translation: He personally gave me the assurance, You great dragon king!

source_sentence: 從今已去，過若干年，若干百年，若干千年，若干百千年，若干百千萬億年，
translation: “Some years have passed since then, some hundreds of thousands of years, some thousand years, some hundreds of thousands of years, some millions of years.

source_sentence: 當有一佛出現於世，號釋迦牟尼多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀。」
translation: There will be a Buddha who appears in the world named Śākyamuni Tathāgata, Arhat, and Samyak-saṃbuddha.

source_sentence: 而今已過如是無量無邊億數百千萬年，叵有彼佛釋迦如來出世以不？』
translation: Now, after these measureless and limitless millions of hundreds of millions of years, isn't it possible for that Buddha or Śākyamuni Tathāgata to appear in the world?'

source_sentence: 「爾時，復更有一龍王，名曰商佉(隋言螺)，彼龍王宮，常有無量龍眾聚會。
translation: At the time, there was another dragon king named Shangqian (known as Luo in the Sui language), whose palace always had an immeasurable number of dragons gathered together.

source_sentence: 而彼會處，多諸龍王百千雲集，伊羅鉢龍亦在彼宮。
translation: At the site of that assembly, there were hundreds of thousands of dragon kings gathered in clouds, and Elāpattra was also in their palace.

source_sentence: 是時，有一夜叉之王，名曰金齊，與伊羅鉢龍王善友，亦在彼龍眾會中坐。
translation: At the time, there was a yakṣa king named Jinqi and good friend of the dragon king Elāpattra, who were also sitting among the assembly of those dragons.

source_sentence: 「爾時，伊羅鉢龍王即於眾中，告夜叉王作如是言：『仁者！
translation: At that point, the dragon king Elāpattra then addressed the king of yakṣas among the crowd and said, 'Sir, my lord!

source_sentence: 汝今頗知世間釋迦如來、多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀出現世未？』
translation: Do you now know that the Tathāgata Śākyamuni Tathāgata, the Tathāgata Akṣobhya, Arhat, and Samyak-saṃbuddha of the world have yet to appear in the world?'

source_sentence: 是時夜叉報龍王言：『大善龍王！
translation: The yakṣa then reported to the dragon king, saying, 'O great good dragon king!

source_sentence: 我實不知釋迦如來出現已未？
translation: I really don't know that the Tathāgata Śākyamuni has yet appeared?

source_sentence: 雖然，龍王！
translation: Although, dragon king!

source_sentence: 但我今知，彼曠野中有於一城，其城本是夜叉宮殿，名阿羅迦槃陀(隋言壙野宮殿)，
translation: But now I know that there is a city in the wilderness. That city was formerly the palace of the yakṣas, called araga-pāṇḍa (known as Āraka-pānda in the Sui).

source_sentence: 彼城先來有二偈文，而彼偈云：「若無有佛出現世間，終無人能讀此偈者；
translation: The city had already composed two verses, but those verses said: If there were no buddhas to appear in the world, there would be absolutely no one who could recite these verses.

source_sentence: 設復有讀，亦不能解此之偈意。
translation: Even if there's another person who reads it, they can't understand the meaning of this verse.

source_sentence: 若當有佛出現世時，即得讀知，無人解義，唯有如來、多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀，
translation: When a buddha appears in the world, he will be able to read and know it. There is no one who understands its meaning but only the Tathāgata, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, Samyak-saṃbuddha,

source_sentence: 能說此義，或有從佛聞而得解。」』
translation: If someone can explain this meaning, they might hear it from the Buddha and attain understanding.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，伊羅鉢龍告彼夜叉王如是言：『仁者！
translation: It was then that the elāpattra dragon addressed the king of yakṣas and said, 'Sir, my dear friend!

source_sentence: 汝今可往至彼讀取彼偈得來以不？』
translation: Now, can you go there and recite that verse to get it?'

source_sentence: 是時金齊夜叉之王，從伊羅鉢龍王邊受如是言已，即便往至彼阿羅迦槃陀宮殿，
translation: Having received these words, the king of the golden-square yakṣas came from the side of the dragon king Airāvaṇḍa and went to the palace of Ārakapāṇḍa.

source_sentence: 受讀彼偈，得已速疾還向伊羅鉢龍王邊。
translation: Having received and recited that verse, he quickly returned to the side of the dragon king Elāpattra.

source_sentence: 到已即白伊羅鉢言：『大善龍王！
translation: When he arrived, he said to Elāpattra, 'O great good dragon king!

source_sentence: 今日應當心生歡喜。
translation: Today, he should become joyous in his heart.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 釋迦牟尼多陀阿伽度、阿羅呵、三藐三佛陀大聖如來，今已出世。
translation: The great sage Tathāgata Śākyamuni, the Tathāgata Samantabhadra, Arhat, and Samyak-saṃbuddha have now appeared in the world.

source_sentence: 何以得知？
translation: How can we know this?

source_sentence: 遂能令我得讀彼偈，我已受持彼偈將來，若有人能解此偈意復能宣說，
translation: If someone understands the meaning of this verse and can expound it, I'll be able to recite it.

source_sentence: 即應當知此是真佛。』
translation: You should know that this is the true Buddha.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，伊羅鉢龍王心大歡喜，踊躍遍身，不能自勝，即從金齊夜叉王邊受取彼偈。
translation: At the time, the dragon king Elāpattra was overjoyed and jumped up and down all over his body, unable to control himself. He accepted the verse from the side of the yakṣa king Jinqi and took hold of it.

source_sentence: 爾時，商佉龍王有女，名曰常分，端正可喜，最上花色，眾人所愛，世無有雙。
translation: At the time, there was a woman named Sadāparibhūta by the dragon king Shangqian who was beautiful and pleasing. She had the color of the finest flower among all the flowers and was loved by everyone in the world without peer

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼會諸龍王等作如是念：『我今應當至月八日、十四、十五，
translation: “At that time, those assembly of nāga kings had this thought:

source_sentence: 或二十三及二十九并三十日，將好金器滿盛銀粟，於銀器內滿盛金粟，
translation: On the twenty-third, twenty-nine, and thirty-three days, he puts a good gold vessel full of silver corn into a silver container and fills it with golden corn inside a silver container.

source_sentence: 將此龍女，莊飾其體，以妙種種瓔珞嚴身，從此龍宮出，置於彼恒河岸上，
translation: They adorned their bodies with various beautiful jewelry and placed them on the banks of the Ganges River.

source_sentence: 著於露地，說此二偈，以示眾人。
translation: On the bare ground, he spoke these two verses to show the crowd.

source_sentence: 「『在於何自在，　　染著名為染，
translation: 'Where is the mastery that defilement is known as defilement?

source_sentence: 彼云何清淨？　　云何得癡名？
translation: How can it be called delusion?

source_sentence: 癡人何故迷？　　云何名智人？
translation: Why is a deluded person called a wise person?

source_sentence: 何會別離已，　　名曰盡因緣。』
translation: What assembly is called the end of causes and conditions after being separated?'

source_sentence: 「時，彼龍王說此偈已，遍告一切諸世間言：『若有能解誦此偈者，我等即當以此金銀盛滿粟等，
translation: Having uttered these verses, the lord of the nāga kings said to all beings in the world: If you recite these verses with understanding, we will fill grains and so forth with gold and silver.

source_sentence: 并及龍女，持用布施，即取彼人，作於佛想。
translation: He and the dragon-maiden gave it as a gift, took that person, and thought of him as a buddha.

source_sentence: 若當有人傳從他聞來為我說，亦然布施。』
translation: If someone were to transmit what they've heard from others and explain it to me, they would likewise give alms.'

source_sentence: 時商佉王及伊羅鉢諸龍王等，欲見世尊，渴仰世尊，思遲世尊，恒以白月黑月八日、十四、十五，
translation: At that time the king of Shang and the nāga kings Elāpattra desired to see the World-honored One. Desiring to see the World-honored One, they cherished the World-honored One for a long time. They thought

source_sentence: 將好金器滿盛銀粟，於銀器內復盛金粟，及彼龍女種種嚴身，將至恒河岸上，
translation: He filled a golden vessel full of good food with silver grains, placed the golden grains in a silver vessel, and carried the various adorned bodies of those dragons and women up to the bank of the Ganges River.

source_sentence: 安置住於陸地。
translation: He placed it on land and stayed there.

source_sentence: 彼二龍王相與而說此二偈言：『在於何自在，乃至盡因緣。』
translation: The two dragon kings spoke these two verses to each other, saying, 'Where is the mastery up to the end of causes and conditions?'

source_sentence: 復作是言：『若有人能解此偈義，我等將此二器金銀，并及端正可憙龍女，
translation: Again, if there is anyone who understands the meaning of this verse, we will offer these two vessels of gold and silver as well as some handsome dragon maidens.

source_sentence: 以用布施。』
translation: It's because they use it to give alms.'

source_sentence: 而彼龍王說於此事，聲聞八方，所有山林，或復在水，或在陸地，或婆羅門，
translation: But the lord of the nāga kings said, “Some of the śrāvakas in the eight directions have mountains and forests that are located either on water, on land, or among the brāhmaṇas.

source_sentence: 或復長者，各相謂言：『白月黑月，恒以六日，彼二龍王從水而出，將於二器，
translation: Again, some householders said to each other, “The white moon and the black moon are always on the sixth day.

source_sentence: 盛金銀粟，及一龍女，瓔珞嚴身，從恒河出，在岸某方陸地住立，說此二偈：「『「在於何自在，
translation: They were filled with gold, silver millet, and a dragon-maiden. With their jewelry adorned bodies they emerged from the Ganges to land on the shore of a certain place and stayed there. They spoke these two verses:

source_sentence: 乃至盡因緣。」
translation: It's up to the end of causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 作如是語：「若有人能讀解此偈，我等將此二器及女而布施。」』
translation: He said, If someone can read and understand this verse, we'll give these two vessels and the woman to them.

source_sentence: 彼時，婆羅門及長者等，從二龍王聞如是語，悉從八方競來集會彼龍王處，
translation: When the brahmans and wealthy householders heard these words from the two nāga kings, they all came from the eight directions to assemble at the place where the nāga king was.

source_sentence: 各自唱言：『我能讀解此之二偈。』
translation: Each one of them called out, 'I can read and understand these two verses.'

source_sentence: 及至龍邊，讀偈不得，又不解義。
translation: When he arrived at the dragon's side, he couldn't read the verse and didn't understand its meaning.

source_sentence: 或復有人讀此偈已，反還問彼二龍王言：『此偈何也？』
translation: Perhaps another person reads this verse and returns to the two dragon kings and asks, 'What's this verse?'

source_sentence: 復問此偈其義云何？
translation: Again, what does this verse mean?

source_sentence: 「時，那羅陀童子仙人，居止在於摩伽陀國，為諸人民而作導師，彼國男女，
translation: “At that time, the holy man Nārada was staying in the country of Magadha as a guide for the people there.

source_sentence: 尊重供承讚歎歌詠那羅陀仙，各相謂言：『此摩那婆，自既知已，復教他知，
translation: Each of them said to the other, “O Manabhadra! Knowing this by himself, he has also taught others to know.

source_sentence: 自既見已，復教他見。』
translation: After seeing it for himself, he then teaches others to see it again.'

source_sentence: 是時，彼國摩伽陀內所有人民，作如是念：『此那羅陀仙聖童子，既自知見，
translation: Then all the citizens of Magadha in that country thought thus:

source_sentence: 教他知見，我等於彼二龍王邊，聞斯二偈，無人能誦，無人能答，我等今可至那羅陀童子仙邊，
到已應說如此之事。』
translation: After arriving, you should explain this kind of thing.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，摩伽陀國諸婆羅門及長者等，即便往至那羅陀仙童子之所，
translation: Having thought thus, the brahmans and wealthy householders of Magadha immediately went to the place where the holy youth Narada was staying.

source_sentence: 到已詳共白那羅陀童子仙言：『仁若知時，恒河岸上有二龍王，一名商佉，
translation: Having arrived, they spoke in detail to the holy man Nārada and said: Sir, when you know this, there are two dragon kings on the bank of the Ganges River.

source_sentence: 二名伊羅鉢，常以白月黑月六日，從恒河水出於陸地，將金銀器，盛粟及女，
translation: On the sixth day of the first month in the white moon and on the sixth day in the black moon, he emerged from the waters of the Ganges River to land. He filled a golden or silver vessel with millet and rice gruel and

source_sentence: 乃至誰能解此偈義，即施與彼說此二偈，偈云：「在於何自在，乃至盡因緣。」』
translation: Whoever can understand the meaning of this verse will give it to them and say these two verses, saying, Where are you at ease, up to the end of the causes and conditions?'

source_sentence: 「爾時，那羅陀仙人童子作是思惟：『我今既為此摩伽陀國內人民作於尊師，
translation: “At that time, the holy man Nārada thought thus:

source_sentence: 此之人民皆供養我，尊重承事欽仰於我，又復謂我自知見已，轉能教他。
translation: These people all offered support to me, honored me, served me, respected me, and venerated me. Moreover, they said, “Once I have seen this, I will be able to teach others.” The Buddha said:

source_sentence: 我今若於是人民前，言我不解此二偈義，此之人民，即毀辱我，一切利養名聞闕少，
translation: Now, if I say to the people here that I don't understand the meaning of these two verses, those people will disparage me, and all benefits and fame will be scarce.

source_sentence: 我皆失之。』
translation: I'll lose them all.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，即便告彼摩伽陀國諸婆羅門大長者等，作如是言：『我共汝等！
translation: After he had this thought, he even addressed the great elders of the brāhmaṇas in that country of Magadha and said, 'I'll share it with you!'

source_sentence: 一時往詣二龍王邊，請說二偈，尋取其義。』
translation: One time, he went to the side of the two dragon kings and asked them to recite two verses to find their meaning.'

source_sentence: 「爾時童子那羅陀仙，共摩伽陀長者人民婆羅門等，左右圍遶，推那羅陀童子仙人最為上首，
translation: At the time, the sage Nārada was surrounded on his left and right by the elders, citizens, brahmans, and others of Magadha. The sage Nārada was the foremost among the ṛṣiṇḍi

source_sentence: 向二龍邊。
translation: He's facing the side of the two dragons.

source_sentence: 到已告言：『二大龍王！
translation: When he arrived, he told them, 'Two great dragon kings!

source_sentence: 願為我等說於二偈，我得聞已，思惟取義。』
translation: May you explain these two verses for us, and after hearing them, I'll contemplate their meaning.'

source_sentence: 爾時，商佉二龍王等，即為彼仙，說二偈云：『在於何自在，乃至盡因緣。』
translation: It was then that the two dragon kings of Shangqiao and others spoke to the sage, saying in two verses, 'Where are you free, up to the end of causes and conditions?'

source_sentence: 「爾時，童子那羅陀仙告彼二龍，作如是言：『我今於汝二龍王邊，受此二偈，
translation: At that time, the ṛṣi Nārada said these two verses to the two nāga kings:

source_sentence: 從今已去，過七日外，當來汝邊答報偈意。』
translation: From now on, after seven days have passed, I'll come to your side to answer the meaning of the verse.'

source_sentence: 時彼二龍白那羅陀童子仙言：『如仁者教，作如是事。』
translation: The two dragons then said to the boy sage Nārada, 'Thus did you do this kind of thing as you taught me.'

source_sentence: 「時，那羅陀從二龍王受得偈已，還向本處。
translation: After receiving the verse from the two dragon kings, Nārada returned to his original place.
